channel.title: Splunk Log Observer on Splunk Observability Cloud Workshops
channel.description: Recent content in Splunk Log Observer on Splunk Observability Cloud Workshops

item.title: 1. Log Filtering
item.description: We have come from a trace to the logs for paymentservice Note that the time window is set to a specific time range that is relevant to the trace which is included in the filter Group By Severity Notice that the chart changes and you have a legend of debug, error and info Click on error, and add to filter Now only have all error fields

item.title: 4. Log View Chart
item.description: Repeat Log Timeline exercise for Log View chart Enter name, description, select dashboard Click save and goto dashboard Explain that if we had 24/7 Synthetic monitoring, we would have been alerted to this issue before our customers were impacted.

item.title: 2. Viewing Log Entries
item.description: Click on an error entry, what is the error?

item.title: 3. Log Timeline Chart
item.description: Click on configure table and ensure the following is selected: k8s.pod_name message version Change to last 15m Remove trace id from the filter and add service.name=paymentservice Click Save to Dashboard and select Log Timeline Enter name, description, select dashboard, new dashboard, name = initial+ War Room Ensure the new dashboard is highlighted Click OK
